classification: Ceramics; Tools, Equipment and Utilitarian Objects
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: clay box with lid, open at both ends, used as a summer sleeping box for crickets; lid is decorated on the underside with an inscription, the handle of the lid with two flowers; to the front of the box is a panel decorated with prunus blossom and an inscription
markings: two inscriptions, one under lid, one on front
title: Cricket summer sleeping box
